page.title: 19WILLERBY CENTRE SURVEY
page.content: Survey conducted in Willerby's main shopping area in July by two pupils, Tracey Taylor and Annabel Gould. Shopping. We interviewed twenty-seven people. Nearly every person we talked to said that the shops needed improving.Most shops were too small, the choice of goods sometimes limited and most things were more expensive than in the large supermarkets.Nearly everyone thought the shopkeepers were friendly and helpful though and the shops were handy for fresh foods and the odd items you forgot.There was even a large, council carpark next to the shops that added to the convenience. Most people went to Hessle (where a new Sainsbury's hypermarket had recently opened,Beverley or Hull to do their main shopping.
